result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco Reynoso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: Ct. 1

Charges:  Ct. 1 - Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), 961.41(1)(cm)1r; Ct. 2 - Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), 961.41(1m)(cm)3
***DEFENDANT IS TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING***
Ct. 2 - GUILTY
Ct. 1 - GUILTY
Sentencing hearing on February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Francisco Reynoso in court with attorney John William Campion.  Interpreter Susan Schweigert appeared.  Interpreter services provided by Daniel Lopez.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.

DAY TWO:
State offers Ex 1,2,3 and reads Ex 3 into the record.  BTC: Rec'd.
State calls J.L., DSAT.
State offers Ex 5, 8 &14.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State calls Sgt. J. BeBow, DSAT.
State calls Inv. H. Friedel, DSAT.
State calls Inv. J. Spaulding, DSAT.
State rests.
Colloquy conducted with defendant re: right to testify.
BTC:  Finding that defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly chooses not to testify.
Defense offers Ex 7.  BTC:  Rec'd.
Defense rests.
Jury Instruction Conference.
Closing Arguments.
Instructions read to the jurors.
Oath #3 given.
Jurors to deliberate 3:01.
Jurors return with verdict 4:15.
VERDICT:
Ct. 1, Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine as PTAC (>1-5g) - GUILTY.
Ct. 2, Possess w/Intent-Cocaine as PTAC (>15-40g)  - GUILTY.
Jurors polled.
State moves for judgment on verdict.
Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.
BTC:  Judgment on verdict is granted.  PSI ordered.
State req that defendant be held without bond.
Defense objects.
BTC:  Defendant to be held without bond.
  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Francisco Reynoso in court with attorney John William Campion.  Interpreter Susan Schweigert appeared.  Interpreter Services provided by Alberto Aguilar.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.

DAY ONE:
Stipulation put on record.
Jury pool brought in.

Voir Dire.
Final jurors selected.  Unselected jurors dismissed.
No objections to jury as selected.
Oath #2 given.
Opening instructions read.
Opening statements.
State calls Investigator D. Nuttall, DSAT.
State offers Ex 4, 6, 6A-6L.  BTC:  Rec'd.
Jurors excused for the evening.
  
Jury trial scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Francisco Reynoso in court with attorney John W. Campion.  Defendant Francisco Reynoso in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
  Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant. Interpreter is sworn by the Court
The State calls Inv. Don Nuttall - DSAT. Direct by the State. Defense stipulates that field tests show the substance tested positive for cocaine for the purpose of this hearing.
Cross by defense. The State has no further witnesses. The State moves to bind over. Defense objects to Ct 2.

BTC: PC found as to both counts. Deft bound over for trial
  Arraignment scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Francisco Reynoso in court with attorney John W. Campion.  Defendant Francisco Reynoso in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests bond mod. State objects. 
BTC: Matter to be adjourned for an interpreter.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Bond motion is denied.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Francisco Reynoso in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Francisco Reynoso in custody.  Interpreter services provided by Vicki Bermudez.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
